alert.note: Alert for Columbia; Montour; Northumberland; Southern Lycoming (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 27 at 5:06PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN NORTHUMBERLAND... MONTOUR...SOUTHEASTERN LYCOMING AND NORTHERN COLUMBIA COUNTIES THROUGH 600 PM EDT... At 505 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 16 miles north of Berwick to 17 miles northwest of Bloomsburg to Montoursville. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation possible. Locations impacted include... Bloomsburg, Berwick, Muncy, Watsontown, Hughesville, Montgomery, Mifflinville, Lightstreet, Buckhorn, Jerseytown, Rohrsburg, Iola, Jamison City, Eyers Grove, Waller, Lairdsville, Central, Mooresburg, Biggertown and Exchange. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until these storms pass.
